chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by department.  
Letter of apology to officer.
Court finds defendant is entitled to NO days jail credit.
Court finds defendant eligible for COP and SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:06 AM 
INCLUDES 13CF729, 13CM1312, 13CM1657, AND 14CF107. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 13CF729, 13CM1312, AND 13CM1657. 
State notes stipulated agreement. 
COURT ORDERS: In 13CF729, Ct. 1 (Forgery - Uttering/Repeater)>>1 year MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment/community service if def qualifies under jail criteria to run consecutive to sentence in 13CM1312 and 13CM1657 and payment of any unpaid court costs. 
                           : In 13CM1312, Ct. 2 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>6 months MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment/community service if def qualifies under jail criteria to run concurrent to sentences in 13CM1657 and consecutive to sentence in 13CF729 and payment of any unpaid court costs. 
                           : In 13CM1657, Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>> 6 months MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment/community service if def qualifies under jail criteria to run concurrent to sentence in 13CM1312 and consecutive to sentence in 13CF729 and payment of any unpaid court costs. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 184 days jail credit in 13CF729 ONLY and NO jail credit in 13CM1312 and 13CM1657.   

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF107. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (DC/repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Throw or Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 5 years imprisonment ( 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision) imposed and STAYED for 3 years probation to run consecutive to sentences in 13CM1312 and 13CM1657 - CONDITIONS: absolute sobriety; AODA; assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by dept; letter of apology to officer; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to NO days jail credit in 14CF107.
COURT finds deft eligible for CIP and SAP in 14CF107.
